text: Rivercene is a historic home located near New Franklin, Howard County, Missouri. It was built in 1869, and is a two-story, nearly square, Second Empire style orange-colored brick dwelling with two wings. It features a slate mansard roof and four wood porches. It was the home of Missouri and Mississippi River steamboat captain Joseph Beeler Kinney. (includes 5 photographs from 1972) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Second Empire architecture in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1869 Category:Buildings and structures in Howard County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Howard County, Missouri
title: Rivercene
